interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Yogi's First Christmas (1980 TV Special)
Review Date: 2021/12/13
Store: Ray Patterson  (Director),     Daws Butler  (Actor),     Don Messick  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas, Comedy
Product Description: ["Yogi and Boo Boo usually snooze right through Christmas. (Hibernation, you know.) But this year, happy holiday music rouses them from their sleep and right into the fun: skating, skiing, singing and trimming the tree. But life isn't all mistletoe and eggnog. Two holiday grouches -- a mysterious hermit and the obnoxious nephew of Jellystone Lodge's owner -- are determined to ruin Christmas. And our two heroes, joined by Snagglepuss, Augie Doggie, Doggie Daddy, Huckleberry Hound and more Hanna-Barbera favorites, are just as determined to make December 25 the jolliest day of the year!"]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Animation/Holidays', 'Format': 'Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Janet Waldo, Ray Patterson, Marilyn Schreffler, Don Messick, Hal Smith, Daws Butler, John Stephenson', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'WARA22252DVD', 'Director': 'Ray Patterson', 'Media Format': 'Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 39 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 2, 2009', 'Actors': 'Daws Butler, Don Messick, Janet Waldo, John Stephenson, Marilyn Schreffler', 'Studio': 'Warner Bros.', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: This is a very fun old Christmas Yogi movie, longer than I remembered. It's great fun for any age kids!
Review Title: Great childhood memory
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Frankenweenie
Martin Short  (Actor),     Catherine O'Hara  (Actor),     Tim Burton  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
['Product Description', 'From Disney and creative genius Tim Burton (ALICE IN WONDERLAND; THE NIGHTMARE BEFORE CHRISTMAS) comes the hilarious and offbeat FRANKENWEENIE, a heartwarming tale about a boy and his dog. After unexpectedly losing his beloved dog Sparky, young Victor harnesses the power of science to bring his best friend back to life -- with just a few minor adjustments. He tries to hide his home-sewn creation, but when Sparky gets out, Victor\'s fellow students, teachers and the entire town learn that getting a new "leash on life" can be monstrous. Complete with electrifying bonus features, FRANKENWEENIE is alive with enchanting fun for the whole family.', 'Brand Story', 'By']
{'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Contributor': "Charlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona RyderCharlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona Ryder  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR786936814149#VG', 'Director': 'Tim Burton', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 8, 2013', 'Actors': "Martin Short, Catherine O'Hara, Martin Landau, Winona Ryder, Robert Capron", 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Number of discs': '1'}
If you do not "get" Tim Burton, this movie may not thrill you, but the art is incredible. You have to consider the pain-stacking stop-motion work despite the odd story-line. This is art at its best. I was only sad that he didn't work with Johny Depp on this one.
You have to love Tim Burton!
Arthur Christmas
Sarah Smith  (Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'How CAN Santa deliver billions of presents to the whole world in just one night? With an army of one million combat-style Field Elves and a vast, state-of-the-art control center under the ice of the North Pole! So how could this incredible operation have MISSED one child?! To Santa’s young son, Arthur, it threatens to end the magic of Christmas. With retired Grandsanta, a rebellious young elf, an old sleigh and some untrained reindeer, Arthur sets out in a crazy mission to deliver the last present! Deck the halls with excitement, fun and wonder in this new Christmas classic!', 'Amazon.com']
{'Genre': 'Family, Animation, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Sarah Smith, David Sproxton, Aardman Animations; Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Animation Inc., Peter Lord, Steve Pegram, Carla ShelleySarah Smith, David Sproxton, Aardman Animations; Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Animation Inc., Peter Lord, Steve Pegram, Carla Shelley   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'December 31, 2017', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '40952', 'Director': 'Sarah Smith', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 6, 2012', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Producers': 'Peter Lord, David Sproxton, Carla Shelley, Steve Pegram', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Seller was great, but this tale of Christmas was awful in many ways. If you don't want a spoiler, don't read, but Christmas now comes from an "alien" sort of ship delivered by thousands of odd looking elves and Santa is just "in charge" - an old sort of "out of it" guy. It is not a classic I will want to watch again. There were terrible moments that made me want to cry. How is that a happy Christmas?
A really bizarre way to represent Christmas
Ice Age: Continental Drift
Ray Romano  (Actor),     Denis Leary  (Actor),     Steve Martino  (Director),     Mike Thurmeier  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
['Product Description', 'Historys greatest heroes return for the most outrageously funny and entertaining Ice Age adventure in two million years. When Scrats acorn antics cause a cataclysmic crack-up, Manny (Ray Romano), Sid (John Leguizamo) and Diego (Denis Leary) go where no herd has gone before on a high-seas quest aboard a floating iceberg. But a menagerie of misfit pirates are determined to shiver their timbers and capsize their journey home. Join a boat-load of lovable new characters (voiced by Jennifer Lopez, Aziz Ansari and Peter Dinklage) for original songs, spectacular animation and heartwarming family fun.', 'Amazon.com', 'The revisionist version of natural history offered up in the', 'Ice Age', 'movies gets yet another twist in the fourth installment, 10 years after Manny the woolly mammoth, Diego the saber-toothed tiger, Sid the sloth, and Scrat the squirrel made their chilly debut to hot box-office receipts. The lessons of family and loyalty in', 'Continental Drift', "may seem a little warmed over, but the creatively constructed laughs, amusing voice characterizations, and inventive CGI animation are reason enough to keep the series viable for kids to giggle about and grownups to belly laugh over--sometimes for exactly the same reasons. Once again, acorn-addicted Scrat is the cause of some pretty important behind-the-scenes machinations. His dialogue-free antics also serve as a stand-alone subplot that could easily be a very clever short film of its own. This time the weasely rodent's addled obsession with the fruit of the oak is revealed as the cause of the formation of the world's continents as we now know them. He sets the story--and planet Earth--in motion while pursuing a little nut in a hyperactive prologue that causes underground rifts that in turn form the famous shapes of Australia, Africa, North America, and the outline of Italy (which it turns out is shaped like a boot for a very good reason). Above ground this means more global chaos for the herd of animals we've come to know so well. All the familiar voices reprise their wonderful roles as fissures in earth and ice separate Manny (Ray Romano) from his woolly wife Ellie (Queen Latifah) and boy-crazy teenager Peaches (Keke Palmer). With a killer continental shelf bearing down on them, mother and daughter lead the madcap pack of animal characters toward a safe meeting place while Manny, Diego (Denis Leary), Sid (John Leguizamo), and Sid's crazy granny (Wanda Sykes) drift away on an iceberg schooner into a newly vast open ocean. While floating into oblivion, the mismatched pack encounters a band of animal pirates piloting another slab of ship-shaped ice, captained by a crazed baboon named Gutt (Peter Dinklage), who's bent on resentment-based revenge. The motley crew provides a plethora of comic encounters and a new raft of excellent voice actors. Running a close second to Dinklage in ingenious casting is Jennifer Lopez as Shira, a sultry tiger who, don't cha know, ends up on the good ship and falling for Diego in the end. The adventures of both the land- and sea-based creatures are full of clever gags and densely constructed set pieces that may not be quite up to Pixar story standards, but are certainly always on the ball and executed with computer-animation acumen that is astonishingly lifelike for such an unreal-looking world. Scrat's misadventures act as interstitial connectors to the parallel heroes' journey stories until they ultimately intersect in a massively scaled finale. Even after all the melting and refreezing, the", 'Ice Age', 'world is still a hot commodity in the animated-franchise business and remains a good investment despite the constancy of global rifts in entertaining family fare.', '--Ted Fry']
{'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FOXS2280028DVD', 'Director': 'Steve Martino, Mike Thurmeier', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Animated, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 11, 2012', 'Actors': 'Ray Romano, Denis Leary', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Why did this do another version of this movie? It's all the same. This version was just more violent and when you thought it could have a really nice ending, they robbed us of that too. Hint, tiger have a mate. Ug.
Same movie, again

['Arnold Schwartzenegger stars as Howard Langston, an overworked mattress salesman who has been neglecting his family of late; in an attempt to redeem himself, he promises his son whatever he wants for Christmas. Turns out that his heart\'s desire is a TurboMan doll, coveted by every other kid this year as well, and Howard quickly forgets about his promise until Christmas Eve. Scooby-Doo! Moon Monster Madness MFV (DVD)
Frank Welker  (Actor),     Mindy Cohn  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Characters & Series, Scooby Doo
['Scooby-Doo! Moon Monster Madness MFV (DVD)', "It's a giant leap for dog-kind as Scooby-Doo and the gang blast off for an epic, otherworldly adventure in this all-new original movie! After winning the last five seats in a lottery, Scooby-Doo, Shaggy, Fred, Daphne and Velma are off to space in billionaire Sly Baron's brand-new ship, the Sly Star One. It's all gravity-free fun until a mysterious alien begins destroying the ship! The crew is forced to land on Sly Baron's base ... on the dark side of the moon! Will the gang unravel this alien mystery? Will Scooby-Doo and Shaggy find snacks on the moon? Will Fred ever take his space helmet off?! Journey to the outer limits with Scooby-Doo to find out!", ']]>']

I bought a few Scooby movies for the holiday. I'm sad to say this is not the original cast. this has someone else as Thelma. Sorry, nothing personal, but she is awful. They try to make up for her voice by having Thelma be a bit stupid in this movie....and allergic to everything in the movie so she is constantly sneezing. It is awful. I'm sorry I wasn't aware of the casting. Not a classic Scooby movie.
This is not a classic Scooby movie.
The Neverending Story (30th Anniversary Edition) [Blu-ray]
Alan Oppenheimer  (Actor),     Jeff Burr  (Actor)    Rated:    PG    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
['The Neverending Story 30th Anniversary (BD)', "When young Bastian borrows a mysterious, ornately-bound book, he never dreamed turning a page would draw him into a shimmering fantasy world of racing snails, hang-glider bats, soaring luckdragons, puckish elves, a Childlike Empress, the brave warrior Atreyu and a slab-faced walking quarry called a Rock Biter. Follow The NeverEnding Story to the limits of the imagination, thanks to director/co-writer Wolfgang Petersen (The Perfect Storm) and a superstar team of technical tinkerers and magicians (with credits including 2001: A Space Odyssey, Alien and The Empire Strikes Back) who bring to life the most delightful characters ever. You'll cherish this wide-eyed adventure and discover The NeverEnding Story is your story.", ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Fantasy, Science Fiction', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Dieter Geissler, Bernd Eichinger, Howard Albrecht, John Hyde, Tami Stronach, Moses Gunn, Mark Damon, Wolfgang Petersen, Jeff Burr, Patricia Hayes, Gerald McRaney, Herman Weigel, Alan Oppenheimer, Sydney BromleyDieter Geissler, Bernd Eichinger, Howard Albrecht, John Hyde, Tami Stronach, Moses Gunn, Mark Damon, Wolfgang Petersen, Jeff Burr, Patricia Hayes, Gerald McRaney, Herman Weigel, Alan Oppenheimer, Sydney Bromley  See more', 'Initial release date': '2014-10-07', 'Language': 'English', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'WHV1000489470BR', 'Director': 'Wolfgang Petersen', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 34 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 7, 2014', 'Actors': 'Alan Oppenheimer, Jeff Burr, Howard Albrecht, Tami Stronach, Moses Gunn', 'Producers': 'Bernd Eichinger, Mark Damon, Dieter Geissler, John Hyde', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Wolfgang Petersen, Herman Weigel', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Only buy this movie if you REALLY loved it in 1984. A friend told me it was a great story. I barely managed to watch the horrible, fake, scenes and special affects of the 1980s. The kid screaming like a quacker, he needs some therapy. Both kids do. I am not sure the point of the story made any sense. Good grief, there's 2 hours of my life I can't get back!
YUCK!

Victor Frankenstein
James McAvoy  (Actor),     Daniel Radcliffe  (Actor),     Paul McGuigan  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
['Superstars James McAvoy and Daniel Radcliffe are electrifying in this action-packed thriller that breathes new life into the most famous horror tale of all time. Radical scientist Victor Frankenstein (McAvoy) and his trusted assistant Igor (Radcliffe) share a noble vision of aiding humanity through their groundbreaking research into immortality. But when Victor s experiments go too far, his obsession has terrifying consequences, and now only Igor can bring his friend back from the brink of madness... and save him from his monstrous creation!']

I know this is an "old" movie, but I wondered about Daniel Radcliffe's delivery. James McAvoy was brilliant! Danielle was fine, he will mature. The movie I loved. While I am squeamish and generally do not watch horror or scare, this was just tolerable enough to not be too much for me. I generally stick with Disney or rated G. One can only take so much emotional manipulation by others, right! I am very happy I watched. If you are not good with gore, watch during the day. It is worth the bit of gross you see now and again.
Great film! Oh and great deal from Amazon!

Frank Welker  (Actor),     Matthew Lillard  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
['Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated The Complete Season Two (DVD)', 'Fred, Daphne, Velma, Shaggy and Scooby-Doo continue to solve mysteries in the spooky town of Crystal Cove, a tourist hotspot that boasts a long history of ghostly sightings, werewolves and glowing deep sea divers. While Crystal Cove tries to capitalize on its haunted reputation, the gang will stop at nothing to unveil the truth behind the paranormal activity. In addition to episodic mysteries, SCOOBY-DOO! MYSTERY INCORPORATED keeps viewers enthralled from episode to episode as the teenagers unravel the overarching mystery of Mister E. and their Mystery Incorporated predecessors. This group of friends gets into their share of disagreements, scary situations, silly antics and even have time for a little romance. In its first season in the U.S., the series averaged nearly two million viewers.', ']]>']

Weird, but if you are a Scooby fan, have to have
Murdoch Mysteries: Christmas Cases Collection
Yannick Bisson  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
["Detective William Murdoch (Yannick Bisson, Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye) and his team solve yuletide crimes in these three feature-length mysteries set in Edwardian Toronto.A Merry Murdoch Christmas—At a charity gala, Murdoch and his wife, Dr. Julia Ogden (Hélène Joy, Durham County), find the host dead from a broken neck; Inspector Brackenreid (Thomas Craig, Coronation Street) suspects the culprit is the legendary Christmas creature Krampus.Once Upon a Murdoch Christmas—When Murdoch investigates a daring robbery where the culprit seemed to possess superhuman abilities, Constable Crabtree (Jonny Harris, Still Standing) realizes the robber resembles a character from his novel.Home for the Holidays—Murdoch and Julia travel to British Columbia to visit Murdoch's brother (Dylan Neal, Dawson’s Creek), but instead of a family holiday, they end up investigating a murder at an archaeological site.Guest stars include Brendan Coyle (Downton Abbey), Kelly Rowan (The O.C.), Megan Follows (Reign, Anne of Green Gables), Kate Hewlett (The Girlfriend Experience), Jake Epstein (Degrassi: The Next Generation), and Ed Asner (The Mary Tyler Moore Show, Up)."]

Murdoch was my favorite series of late until this Season 11. They finally pushed it too far for me with violence. Sadly, I don't care to watch it anymore. It had been a series of romance and mystery that until now I enjoyed. Everyone has different limits.
Was my favorite
The Addams Family 2019
Oscar Isaac  (Actor),     Charlize Theron  (Actor),     Conrad Vernon  (Director, Producer),     Greg Tiernan  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD

['SANTA\'S APPRENTICE / MAGIC SNOWFLAKE - DVD - "Santa\'s Apprentice: Santa doesn\'t want to retire, but rules are rules and he must train someone to replace him. The lucky winner, to be chosen from among millions of children, must be named Nicholas, be an orphan and have a pure heart. On the other side of the planet, there is a little boy who is a perfect match, but his lack of self-confidence and fear of heights make him a poor contestant. Will Santa agree to step down, and help his apprentice take his place? - "The Magic Snowflake": A young boy named Nicholas is about to become the next Santa Claus, but must first avoid a crisis that\'s threatening the magic of Christmas before he can succeed in his new role.']

Yogi's First Christmas (1980 TV Special)
Ray Patterson  (Director),     Daws Butler  (Actor),     Don Messick  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas, Comedy
["Yogi and Boo Boo usually snooze right through Christmas. (Hibernation, you know.) But this year, happy holiday music rouses them from their sleep and right into the fun: skating, skiing, singing and trimming the tree. But life isn't all mistletoe and eggnog. Two holiday grouches -- a mysterious hermit and the obnoxious nephew of Jellystone Lodge's owner -- are determined to ruin Christmas. And our two heroes, joined by Snagglepuss, Augie Doggie, Doggie Daddy, Huckleberry Hound and more Hanna-Barbera favorites, are just as determined to make December 25 the jolliest day of the year!"]

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Favorite Genre**: The user maintains a strong preference for animation, especially family-friendly content that features unique storytelling. They continue to appreciate narratives that blend heartwarming themes with darker elements and are enthusiastic about charming holiday-themed stories.

- **Preferred Directors**: Distinctive filmmakers like Tim Burton, Wolfgang Petersen, and Paul McGuigan remain favorites, reflecting the user's admiration for creative storytelling.

- **Artistic Appreciation**: They see animation as a dynamic art form and have a keen interest in stop-motion techniques while also enjoying quality live-action narratives.

- **Emotional Depth**: The user values stories that offer emotional integrity and traditional values, expressing dissatisfaction with excessive violence or distracting character portrayals.

- **Content Engagement**: Actively providing feedback, they prioritize authentic storytelling and emotional connections across media, particularly in family-oriented content.

- **Value in Collaborations**: The user is intrigued by innovative collaborations among talented actors and directors.

- **Recent Insights**: They are critical of recent animated interpretations of classic series due to incoherent storytelling and character portrayals. Nonetheless, they continue to cherish nostalgic holiday films, emphasizing the importance of narrative integrity and character authenticity in their viewing choices. 

This recent engagement reinforces their commitment to quality animation and the enjoyment of timeless family-friendly holiday tales.
